title: #GerofitExercise: Foundational Fitness
summary:
This #GerofitExercise session is a 44-minute full body routine designed to build a strong base for health and mobility. Led by Physical Therapist Paul Froehlich and Nurse Coordinator Iliana Reyes, this routine focuses on essential movements including cardio, strength, balance and flexibility. These are suitable for individuals of all abilities and can be performed with little to no equipmentDeveloping a foundational fitness habit is vital for your physical, mental, and emotional health, especially as you age. Join our Gerofit team for a great workout today! If you find this video helpful, please share it with family and friends, and be sure to check out our other #Gerofitexercise videos.

Video Chapters:
00:00 Veteran Testimonial
00:29 Disclaimer
01:04 Introduction
02:24 Warm Up
06:39 Strength First Round
15:34 Strength Second Round
26:32 Cardio Section
33:18 Balance/3rd Round
38:24 Cool Down

title: PTSD and Substance Use Disorder
summary: PTSD and Substance Use Disorder: Learn about how posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and substance use problems are related. This short animated video describes both PTSD and substance use disorder and describes treatments that work for both. Created by VA’s National Center for PTSD.

title: Improving Your Daily Life with PTSD Treatment
summary: • Improving Your Daily Life with PTSD Treatment: When you complete an effective treatment for posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) it’s likely that you will be better able to manage daily life. PTSD symptoms can get in the way of work, school, parenting, relationships, and more. In PTSD treatment, you can talk with your provider about how to improve your daily life as well as get relief from symptoms. Created by VA’s National Center for PTSD.

title: Onboard USS Makin Island, 13th MEU and PHIBRON 7 Strengthen Navy-Marine Corps Integration During Amphibious Training
summary: The Navy-Marine Corps team has concluded Quarterly Underway Amphibious Readiness Training (QUART) 26.2, which took place from Jan. 20-30, 2026. The exercise, led by the 13th Marine Expeditionary Unit (MEU) and Amphibious Squadron (PHIBRON) 7, featured the Wasp-class amphibious assault ship USS Makin Island (LHD 8), which expanded the training's ability to prepare MEUs and Amphibious Ready Groups (ARGs) for future deployments and operations afloat. Further strengthening international partnerships, Peruvian naval officers were aboard to observe the exercise, fostering shared learning and military cooperation.

title: Policy Brief: Teen Mental Health and School-Based Services in California
summary: Rates of chronic sadness and suicidal thoughts in teens have been rising in California—and nationwide—since about 2009. Significant gaps exist between the reported need for mental health care and receipt of services. The state has recently invested $8 billion for child and teen mental health, including school-based services.

source: The Official United States Marine Corps Public Website News
title: 2nd Marine Logistics Group 3D printed Drone
summary: Sgt. Henry David Volpe, an automotive maintenance technician with 2nd Marine Logistics Group, has successfully developed HANX, the Marine Corps’ first NDAA-compliant, 3D-printed drone platform. Developed at the II MEF Innovation Campus in just 90 days, the HANX drone represents a major leap in tactical manufacturing by providing a low-cost, modular system that is resilient against adversary software. By utilizing 3D printing and off-the-shelf parts that meet rigorous security standards, Sgt. Volpe and his team have moved drone production from external contractors directly into the hands of Marines. This "by Marines, for Marines" innovation aligns with the Department of War’s "Drone Dominance" initiative, offering a versatile tool for reconnaissance or one-way attack missions that can be built and modified anywhere in the fleet.

summary:
CVA Executive Director, John Vick, on Thursday testified before the House Committee on Veteran Affairs on the state and future of Community Care and veteran heath care. Key excerpts: “CVA’s view of veterans’ health care is simple: at all times, veterans should have the choice of seeking care either at a VA facility or a […]

The post CVA’s John Vick Testifies to House Veteran Affairs Committee on Community Care appeared first on Concerned Veterans for America.

title: Don Lemon's Wild Church Hijack: KKK Act in Play?
summary:
Has Don Lemon turned church crasher? Explore the allegations of First Amendment abuses as we dig into a narrative where law meets disorder.

Let’s not mince words: are elected officials in Los Angeles County more committed to sanctuary than security? Discover the blurring lines between state responsibility and federal authority, and brace yourself for a dive into a chaotic legal landscape where even the Ku Klux Klan Act is dusted off for action.

title: Who’s Leaving California—and Who’s Moving In?
summary: Almost 10 million people have moved from California to other states since 2010, while just over 7 million people moved to California from other parts of the country. Lower-income households have been much more likely to leave the state than higher-income households.

source: Publication Archive - Public Policy Institute of California
title: Arrests in California
summary: In 2024, California’s overall arrest rate rose for the first time in 20 years. Racial/ethnic disparities in arrest rates have narrowed over time but remain significant.

title: Janneck Peersman Joins Intact
summary:
Intact, an inspection, audit, certification, and standards software company, has announced the appointment of Janneck Peersman as Vice President of Customer Success and Market Strategy. Peersman, who has a wealth of experience in the testing, inspection, and certification (TIC) sector, is uniquely positioned to drive forward the company’s continuous improvement efforts. He brings Intact deep […]

Janneck Peersman Joins Intact on The Auditor.

title: CA SB892
summary:
An act to amend, repeal, and add Section 66025.8 of the Education Code, relating to public postsecondary education.

2026/01/15 From printer. May be acted upon on or after February 14.

title: California’s Population
summary: More people live in California than any other state. Growth has slowed dramatically over the past quarter century, but the state’s population is still one of the most diverse in the nation.

title: The Year Ahead for the California Legislature
summary: How can California legislators work across the aisle to solve our state's most pressing issues? Join PPIC president and CEO Tani Cantil-Sakauye for a wide-ranging conversation with Assembly Republican Leader Heath Flora and Democratic Assemblymember José Luis Solache, Jr.
